ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: The pressure drop across an orifice is measured for a particular flow rate. If the flow rate is doubled, keeping all other parameters constant, then the effect on the pressure drop across the orifice is:
ENGLISH.OPT4: It will increases by four times.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: An accelerometer has a seismic mass of 0.15 kg and a spring constant of 1.5 × 103 N/m. If the maximum mass displacement is ± 0.05 m before the mass hits the stop, the peak acceleration of the seismic mass is________m/s2.

A liquid in glass thermometer can be considered as a single capacity system with a time constant of 3.5 sec with unity gain. If it is quickly taken from a temperature of 0°C to a water bath having temperature 100°C, then the reading indicated by the thermometer after 1.5 seconds will be _________°C.

In a laminar flow experiment two fluid A and B are flowing into two identical pipes at the same Reynolds number and at the same volumetric flow rate. The densities of fluid A and B are same but the pressure drop per unit length is 2 times in case of B than that of A. The ratio of dynamic viscosity of fluid A to B is

For a chromel-constantan (type E) thermocouple, the junction potential E ( in μV) at θ°C is given by

E = 58.66 θ + 4.54 × 10–2 θ2 +2.89 × 10–5 θ3 – 3.30 × 10–7 θ4 + higher order terms.
Assuming the cold junction compensation. The sensitivity of thermocouple at 100°C is

A platinum RTD is incorporated in the op-amp circuit as shown in figure. The nominal value of RTD resistance is 100 Ω at 25°C and temperature coefficient of 0.004/°C. The value of output voltage at 75°C is ___________ V.

A copper-constantan thermocouple was found to have linear calibration between 0 and 400°C with emf at maximum temperature (reference junction temperature 0°C) equal to 20.68 mV. The temperature of a hot object is measured by this thermocouple with reference Junction at 25°C as shown in the figure. If the indicated emf is 8.92 mV in the thermocouple circuit then the temperature of the hot junction is_____°C

The temperature of an object was found with the help of a thermistor having β = 3140 K. The nominal resistance (at 273 K) of the thermistor is 1 kΩ. The thermistor is coupled to an op-amp circuit as shown in the figure. If the temperature of the object rises to 100°C, then the output voltage of the circuit will be________V.
A C-type Bourdon tube is used to measure pressure in a pipe and it indicates a pressure of 20 kPa. If atmospheric pressure is 101.3 kPa. Then the absolute pressure in the pipe (in kPa) is

The level of the water stored in truncated conical bath is measured by a gamma-ray radiation sensor. The initial level of water is 1 m, and the level is increasing due to water inflow at the constant rate of 0.125 m3/sec. Assume mass absorption coefficient of water is 77 × 10–4 m2/kg density of water is 1000 kg/m3.

Calculate the time elapsed such that the intensity of radiation received by the floating detector is half of the intensity detected initially.

In a falling ball viscometer, the ball attains terminal velocities of 0.05 m/s for oil A and 0.10 m/s for oil B. Assuming the oils have the same density and oil A has kinematic viscosity of 10 × 10–3 m2/s, the kinematic viscosity of oil B in m2/s is
A platinum thermometer has a resistance of 100 Ω at 25°C. If the platinum has a resistance temperature coefficient of 0.00392/°C, then its resistance at 125°C is ________Ω.

A McLeod gauge has volume of bulb and measuring capillary V = 100 × 10–6 m3 and a measuring capillary area of 100 mm2. If the reading of the measuring capillary is 50 mm then the pressure indicated by the gauge (using approximation) is _________ mm.

A chromel-alumel thermocouple is assumed to have linear operating range upto 1200°C with emf (reference junction temperature 0°C) 46.25 mV at this temperature. The thermocouple is exposed to a temperature of 800 °C with reference junction at 25 °C. Then the emf generated by the thermocouple is ________ mV.

A semiconductor temperature sensor shown in the figure is used to measure the temperature of hot air. The output voltage V0 is 4.5 V. The current output of the sensor is given by = TμA where T is the temperature in K. Assuming the opamp to be ideal, the temperature of hot air in °C is approximately________.

True model of a RTD is,
RT = R0 [1 + 0.006 T – 2 × 10–6 T2]
where T is in °C and R0 at 0°C = 100
It is approximated to a linear model (by ignoring higher orders) in temperature from –50°C to 100°C. Possible values of % error is/are
